title: Defining Local Minimum
text: A function f has a local minimum at $$x=b$$ if there exists an interval (a,c) with $$a<b<c$$ such that, for any $$x$$ in the interval (a,c), $$f(x) \geq f(b)$$. In other words, a local minimum is a low point on the graph.

title: Local Minimum
text: At which $$x$$ does the graph attain a local minimum?

subHints.title: Local Minimum
subHints.text: The graph attains a local minimum at $$x=-1$$ because it is the lowest point in an open interval around $$x=-1$$.
